spec:
I will create a timer app with the following features:
1. A start/stop button to control the timer
2. A reset button to reset the timer to 0
3. The timer will display minutes and seconds
4. The timer will update in real-time
5. The timer will have an initial countdown of 60 seconds
6. The timer will display the elapsed time since the start button was pressed
html:
\
1:00
\
\ \ \
\
js:
let interval;\
    let startTime;\
    let elapsedTime = 0;\
    let isRunning = false;\
    \
    function formatTime(time) {\
        const minutes = Math.floor(time / 60);\
        const seconds = time % 60;\
        return `${minutes}:${seconds.toString().padStart(2, '0')}`;\
    }\
    \
    function updateTimer() {\
        const currentTime = Math.floor((Date.now() - startTime + elapsedTime) / 1000);\
        document.getElementById('timer').textContent = formatTime(currentTime);\
    }\
    \
    document.getElementById('start-stop').addEventListener('click', () => {\
        if (!isRunning) {\
            startTime = Date.now();\
            isRunning = true;\
            document.getElementById('start-stop').textContent = 'Stop';\
            interval = setInterval(updateTimer, 1000);\
        } else {\
            isRunning = false;\
            elapsedTime += Date.now() - startTime;\
            clearInterval(interval);\
            document.getElementById('start-stop').textContent = 'Start';\
        }\
    });\
    \
    document.getElementById('reset').addEventListener('click', () => {\
        isRunning = false;\
        elapsedTime = 0;\
        clearInterval(interval);\
        document.getElementById('timer').textContent = '1:00';\
        document.getElementById('start-stop').textContent = 'Start';\
    });\
    \
    document.getElementById('timer').textContent = formatTime(60);
description: A timer app that allows the user to start, stop, and reset a timer. The timer displays the elapsed time in minutes and seconds and updates in real-time. The timer starts with an initial countdown of 60 seconds.
